When INVALID, CLOSED, or EXPIRED, withdrawal will not be possiblethat OPEN is present tense`msg.sender` is equal the recipient of the token`block.timestamp` is less than `expiration value` for valid withdrawal`_swapState[_securityToken][_swapID] = OrderLibrary.SwapState.CLOSED`    closes the order for the token address after successful withdrawal`_orderSwap[_securityToken][_swapID]._secretKey = _secretKey;` to update the secretKey value of the OrderSwap data for that ID"},"refund(bytes32,address)":{"notice":"`_order._issuer` should be msg.sender`_order._expiration` should be lesser than the current time.  In order words, the order has expired`ERC1400_TOKEN.transferByPartition` refunds the issuer`_swapState[_swapID] = OrderLibrary.SwapState.EXPIRED` sets the order's state to EXPIRED"}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"project:/contracts/htlc/HTLC1400.sol":"HTLC1400"},"evmVersion":"london","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"project:/contracts/htlc/HTLC1400.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc67c46360af9af72cd64719a9f188f3062647ececc2b8778cfb02732424c1dfb","license":"UNLICENSED","urls":["bzz-raw://f1fdae5e9a0f2cf8946d55ea759d080764b0c17cfedc54fc5c1137ee0a738b7d","dweb:/ipfs/QmRNafKpmKPRZTTN5gdKvUDRxaABbwC2n4QoMgXB8nH8L6"]},"project:/contracts/utils/IERC1400.sol":{"keccak256":"0x633b766667d3ff1c00409f1ecbaff50fadc9faa06ca7ec3d89f5257b48085202","urls":["bzz-raw://0a5c9a69a2871c18531bf596678767d305319b1d4e0f06bc008f417bfb254bae","dweb:/ipfs/Qme9quYaWwZBMH7rDGYrZv9NNx6zPezwSrS4DZuUrGCG1Y"]},"project:/contracts/utils/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5aa5d346ad9761e5bd986c3f0bcbc55b9e7ae7db14252b66eea2e63de0caf229","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ac0ef653c6bb15e2d2d9d94109149015d78d4f0f667f9f64601ad31f31e65f1a","dweb:/ipfs/QmURSbqfbeiEKD9VQmToCmxWXdBQS14ETjq5AP8thhVBXf"]},"project:/contracts/utils/OrderLibrary.sol":{"keccak256":"0x95ccf60466fab64f8a973c362a222bdc5e81167bfc9883bb05929a8b8bd79d80","urls":["bzz-raw://14d728e36fd3b6d1e8cb90d8fde92ec9dd8d3ebf5f5f27171b395b241b8791f1","dweb:/ipfs/QmVVcXxMzbDCCJVp96pERCUDgDYSiosUGccKL9TDR7XtM6"]}},"version":1}

documentation.text:
@param _swapID is the id of the order to be fetched
 @notice `_swapID` must not be INVALID. it can be OPEN, CLOSED or EXPIRED.

params._swapID: is the id of the order to be fetched

openOrder(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,bytes3.details: when an order is opened, the issuer funds the contract with the tokenthis htlc contract address should be approved as an operator using "authorizeOperator" accross all partitions or "authorizeOperatorByPartition" for the specific partitions where tokens need to be deposited for the atomic swapwith the uniqueness of the IDS, the secrets dont have to be unique accross the blockchain. The unique ID will keep track of each unique swap orders

params._data: is the encoded certificate that will be decoded to ensure that the recipient is a whitelisted investor
params._expiration: is the time the token withdrawal elasp. There will be a refund to the issuer's wallet if the token isn't withdrawn
params._investor: is the target recipient/withdrawal of the deposited token
params._partition: is the partition where the token will be withdrawn into, in the investor's wallet
params._secretHash: is the hash of the secret that must be provided by the recipient for the recipient to withdraw the security token
params._secretKey: is the secret word or phrase attached to an order
params._securityToken: is the address of the security token to be deposited by the issuer and to be withdrawn by the investor
params._swapID: is the ID of the swap order that keeps track of the state of the order. The withdrawee will make reference to this ID on this contract and their deposit contract as well. The SwapState of that ID must be invalid which means it has not been used
params._tokenValue: is the amount of token to be withdrawn by the investor

params._secretKey: is the secret the recipient provides to withdraw the token from the htlc contract
params._swapID: is the ID of the order. The ID provided must be valid
is the id of the order to refunded to the issuer

_orderSwap.details: The swap state solves some of the following security problem:

devdoc.title: HTLC to release security from issuer to investor

checkOrder(bytes32,address).notice: `_swapID` must not be INVALID. it can be OPEN, CLOSED or EXPIRED.

openOrder(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,bytes3.notice: the security token address is used to keep track of the order and swap state IERC1400(_orderSwap[_securityToken][_swapID]._ERC1400_ADDRESS).operatorTransferByPartition function moves the tokens from the issuer wallets to the htlc address

recipientWithdrawal(bytes32,bytes32,addr.notice: the existence of the hash of the secret is checked to be sure that it existthe swap state of the ID is checked to ensure that a recipient can only attempt a withdrawal when it's OPEN. When INVALID, CLOSED, or EXPIRED, withdrawal will not be possiblethat OPEN is present tense`msg.sender` is equal the recipient of the token`block.timestamp` is less than `expiration value` for valid withdrawal`_swapState[_securityToken][_swapID] = OrderLibrary.SwapState.CLOSED`    closes the order for the token address after successful withdrawal`_orderSwap[_securityToken][_swapID]._secretKey = _secretKey;` to update the secretKey value of the OrderSwap data for that ID

refund(bytes32,address).notice: `_order._issuer` should be msg.sender`_order._expiration` should be lesser than the current time.  In order words, the order has expired`ERC1400_TOKEN.transferByPartition` refunds the issuer`_swapState[_swapID] = OrderLibrary.SwapState.EXPIRED` sets the order's state to EXPIRED
